forumNotes.author: tenno
forumNotes.content:
I am trying to convert some Windows XP Embedded plain SDI-Ramdisks to use XP WIM booting technologie described elsewhere in this forum. This reduced the footprint of the TFTP download dramatically. I am using gpxelinux vesamenu and have already tried ftp/http download protocol ( waisting 180MB of 512MB RAM ).
Playing with "bcdedit.exe /? TYPES DEVOBJECT" i found settings for

RAMDISKTFTPBLOCKSIZE (integer) Defines the Trivial File Transfer Protocol (TFTP) block size for the RAM disk Windows Imaging (WIM) file. RAMDISKTFTPWINDOWSIZE (integer) Defines the Trivial File Transfer Protocol (TFTP) window size for RAM disk Windows imaging (WIM) file.
Is it possible to tune TFTP download speed by setting appropriate values for RAMDISKTFTPWINDOWSIZE? Is it possible to avoid the TFTP ACK roundtrip delays. Is there any usefull backgroundinformation?


Kind regards Harald **Edited by tenno, 17 December 2010 - 08:58 PM.**
